intro: Typhonium listeri var. geniculatum, commonly known as the giant arrowroot or swamp arrowroot, is a tropical plant belonging to the Araceae family. It is characterized by its large,戟-shaped (spear-shaped) leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces an inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. It thrives in wet, marshy environments and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. The plant is often cultivated for its edible corms, which are similar in texture to taro.
